owl:Ontology.terms:description: An ontology to describe provenance of data anonymization workflows (i.e., data linkage) in high security research environments such as the Scottish Safe Haven.
owl:Ontology.terms:title: The Safe Haven Provenance (SHP) Ontology
owl:Ontology.rdfs:label: The SHP Ontology

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A property for linking data sources to corresponding data plans.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: data source

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Short name of source database
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: abbreviation

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Number of cohort members successfully linked
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: cohort members linked

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Number of cohort members not linked
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: cohort members not linked

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Number of eligible cohort members with an incorrect or missing identifier as linkage variable
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: cohort members with invalid linkage variable

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Unique identifier for cohort file used in extraction
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: cohort permamnet id

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Total number of people in the cohort. This number was either determined by the analyst before the before the data linkage process or was provided by the researcher.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: cohort size

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
Data linkage Plan: The cohort specification based on the researchers criteria to answer their research question.
Dataset: How the Lead Analyst defined the cohort
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: cohort specification

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Point of contact for questions about source database
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: contact

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Web URL or folder path that point to the contextual information of the source data such as e.g. Metadata, variable definition, collection methods etc.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: contextual information link

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Data custodian of source database
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: data custodian

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Name of source database
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: database name

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: List of all datasets extracted and released into the project folder of the researcher
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: extracted datasets

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: List of variables extracted from the database to form the dataset
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: extracted variables

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: File date used in DASH project folder
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: file date

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Assigned file name representing the particular entity and which will be included into the project folder released to the researcher
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: file name

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: When was the last known update of the database, before it was used to generate the dataset for the research project
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: last known update

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Variable used for linkage to source dataset
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: linkage variable

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Date of the most recent record in database.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: most recent record date

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A number of records in the dataset
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: number of records

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The date and time of the oldest record in the database
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: oldest record date

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Unique identifier for source database
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: permanent id

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Project IDs are assigned to a project by the Research Coordinator as soon as a researcher makes contact with the Data Safen Haven and wants to discuss his project idea.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: project id

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A data property describing the variables that should be extracted from a specific data source defined in the linkage plan
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: requested variables

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The results of a DataCheck-activity that generated DashReport-Enity. Currently it is recommended that is either has the values “passed” or “failed”.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: result of check

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Each dataset of a project get its own unique Study ID assigned. The Study ID will used as a prefix (usually 4 digits) for anonymised ID number.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: study id

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Database version
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: version

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Analyst is responsible for the validation checks
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Analyst

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: activitiies that anonymize data or identifiers
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Anonymization

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Replacing the dataset specific anonymised UIDs with a common UID across all of the projects datasets, in other words linking anonymised UIDs
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Assign Common Uid Mapping

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A check value that allows to determine whether a file has been changed or not. When it shouldn’t
NOTE: the activity (UidMapping2Check) that generates this report is not yet official implemented into the workflow of the Analysts.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Check Value

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The cohort is either created by the Analyst based on the specification provided by the researcher or based on a cohort list provided by the researcher
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Cohort Creation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A list of all people in the cohort for the project from which the cohort size is derived
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Cohort List

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Replacing the dataset specific anonymised UIDs with a common UID across all of the project's datasets, in other words linking anonymised UIDs
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Create Common UID

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Activities that are happening during the data linkage processActivities that are happening during the data linkage process
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Dash Activity

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A research project in a high security enviroment so called Data Safe Haven (Dash)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Dash Project

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Documents that bare some form of importance and information required for the data linkage process of the project
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Dash Project Document

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Reports related to validation checks, disclosure checks and sum checks
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Dash Report

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: De-identifying data, for example aggregating postcodes to datazones, modifying date of birth to month of birth or providing age in years at specific dates
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Anonymization

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Group of activities that validates the data linkage process for the project and ensure all the necessary permission are in place for the researcher.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Check

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The Data Linkage Plan details the databases and variables that are going to be linked for a project
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Linkage Plan

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Extracting the dataset from the database based on cohort definition provided by the researcher and specified in the Data Linkage Plan
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Selection

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Is a cohort-based subset of the Database
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Dataset

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Datasets and Linkage Dataset flat-files securely transferred to the Data Safe Haven
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Transfer

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: a database or data source from which datasets are derived
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Database

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Linkage file maps the original identifiable ID (e.g. such as CHI) in the respective dataset to a project and dataset specific new UID. In other words, those UIDs are different for each dataset in a project. This is to prevent premature linkage of the data before is has been fully anonymised.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Dataset Linkage ID Mapping

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Flat-files (Datasets), Data Linkage Plan and statistical summary are transferred to project folder, which is accessible to researcher.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Dataset Release

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A statistical summary of the dataset is created. The following values are generated regardless of variable type: datatype, Completeness, Total entries, % non null, minimum, maximum, smallest disclosed number
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Dataset Summarisation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Technical Lead checks the prepared datasets for disclosive elements. Disclosure checks have more of an emphasis on validity of permissions. Known as ‘sign off’. This is a key step prior to data moving from e.g. NHS side to the data safe haven. It generates a disclosure check report.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Disclosure Check

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Report of the results of the disclosure checks, which indicates if the work of the Lead analyst has passed or failed the disclosure check.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Disclosure Check Report

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Outcome of the Dislcousre Check when it FAILED
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Failed Disclosure Check

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Outcome of the Validation Check when it FAILED
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Failed Validation Check

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: It generates a check value (e.g. “sum check”) for a file to help determine if the file had been changed or not.
NOTE: This activity is not yet official implemented into the workflow of the Analysts.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Generate Check Value

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Replacing the original identifiers in the dataset with a new anonymized unique identifier specific for that dataset.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ID Anonymization

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Create a unique identifier (UID) mapping table for each anonymized dataset, which maps the original identifier (non-anonymized) of the dataset to the new assign anonymized UIDs for that dataset.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ID Linkage

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Lead Analyst is responsible for the whole data linkage process of the project. Depending on the data safe haven, the analysts may or may not have the right to see and work on the non-anonymized data.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Lead Analyst

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Holds the names of the source databases that are listed in the Data Linkage Plan for the project. This is to check wether all databases had been used in the data linkage process or not.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Linkage Plan Data Source

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A database from the Nathional Heath Service of the United Kingdom, that hold electronic health records. These are routinely collected data generated when an individual receivescare in a health care setting.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: NHS database

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A dataset derived from an NHS database
owl:Class.rdfs:label: NHS Dataset

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Once all datasets for the project have had anonymised IDs applied and a linkage dataset created, the original IDs are removed from the UID mapping table (a dataset moves from Pre-Release to Release)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Original ID Removal

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Outcome of the Dislcousre Check when it PASSED
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Passed Disclosure Check

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Outcome of the Validation Check when it PASSED
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Passed Validation Check

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Project IDs are assigned to a project by the Research Coordinator as soon as a researcher makes contact with the Data Safen Haven and wants to discuss his project idea
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Project ID Assignment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This table tracks which Project ID has which Study IDs assigned. Each Project has one Project ID, but can have multiple Study IDs. As each dataset of the project get its own unique Study ID assigned. Project IDs are assigned to a project by the Research Coordinator as soon as a researcher makes contact with the Data Safen Haven and wants to discuss his project idea.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Project ID to Study ID Table

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Research Coordinators facilitate the use of routinely collected data for health research. Research Coordinators support researchers from academia, NHS and industry to design, plan, gather permissions and conduct research involving health and administrative data.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Research Coordinator

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A person whose research may require a high-secure environment (Data Safe Haven).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Researcher

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: to give approval
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Sign Off

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Give a summary statistic (e.g. mean, max, min etc) of a dataset regardless the data type (e.g. integer, string, character, Boolean etc.)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Statistical Summary

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Datasets and Linkage dataset exported from SQL to flat-files
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Storage

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Update the ProjectID To StudyID Table with a new the ProjectID to StudyID pairs for use in linkage/anonymisation
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Study ID Assignment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Has overall responsibilities and does the disclosure checks. They should have the right to access the non-anonymized data.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Technical Lead

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: NOTE: the activity (UidMapping2Check) that generates this report is not yet official implemented into the workflow of the Analysts.

Report of the results of the UidMapping2Check, which indicates if the UidMapping2-file or table has changed after the original IDs were removed. It should never change after the original IDs were removed and before the new common UIDs are assigned.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: UID-Mapping-2 Check Report

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Unique Identifier mapping file, maps the corresponding UID in the different dataset in a project to each other. This allows the correct linkage later, once the dataset have been fully anonymised
owl:Class.rdfs:label: UID Mapping

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: It checks whether the UidMapping2-file or table has changed after the original IDs were removed or not, using check values (e.g. “sum check”). It should never change after the original IDs were removed and before the new common UIDs are assigned.
NOTE: This activity is not yet official implemented into the workflow of the Analysts.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: UID-Mapping-2 Check

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A document is updated
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Update

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A second DaSH Analyst checks activities to this point. Includes check against requirements and permissions. Validation checks concentrate on technical aspects, whether the coding is correct and that datasets match the Data Linkage Plan. It generates a validation check report.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Validation Check

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Report of the results of the validation checks, which indicates if the work of the Lead analyst has passed or failed the validation check.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Validation Check Report
